intro: Acetosella pilosissima, commonly known as the silky wood sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves with a dense covering of fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and easily identifiable species within its native habitat.
